block.p: Capital One Bank, Falls Church, Va., is selling $200 million of senior bank notes due in 1999 through Lehman Brothers. The noncallable notes carry an interest rate of 7.2 percent and are priced at par. The issue is rated Baa3 by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and BBB- by the Standard & Poor's Corp.

Capital One Bank, Falls Church, Va., is selling $200 million of senior bank notes due in 1999 through Lehman Brothers. The noncallable notes carry an interest rate of 7.2 percent and are priced at par. The issue is rated Baa3 by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and BBB- by the Standard & Poor's Corp.

Federal Home Loan Bank is selling $50 million of bonds due in 1999 through Bear, Stearns & Co. The bonds are callable quarterly beginning Oct. 29, 1996, carry an interest rate of 7.045 percent and are priced at par.

Federal Home Loan Bank is selling $50 million of bonds due in 1999 through First Tennessee Bank. The bonds have a one-time call on July 30, 1997, carry an interest rate of 6.79 percent and are priced at par.
Federal Home Loan Bank is selling $25 million of bonds due in 2000 through Morgan Keegan & Co. Inc. The bonds are callable in six months, carry an interest rate of 7.12 percent and are priced at par.

Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp., known as Freddie Mac, is selling $35 million of debentures due in 1999 through Nationsbanc Capital Markets. The noncallable debentures carry an interest rate of 6.54 percent and are priced at par.

Household Finance Corp., Prospect Heights, Ill., is selling $250 million of notes due in 2003 through J. P. Morgan Securities. The notes are priced at 99.985 to yield 7.253 percent. The issue is rated A2 by Moody's, A by S.& P. and A+ by Duff & Phelps.

Student Loan Marketing Association, known as Sallie Mae, is selling $50 million of medium-term step-up notes due in 2001 through Merrill Lynch & Co. The notes have a one-time call on July 30, 1997, and carry an initial interest rate of 6.4 percent. If the issue is not called, the coupon steps up to 7.75 percent and is priced at par.
